mhT5NavY.title: Spatial Characteristics of Agricultural Ecological Security and Policy Suggestions in Chongqing City
mhT5NavY.abstract: On the basis of establishing the indicator system for evaluation of agricultural ecological security,the spatial pattern of agriculture ecological security in Chongqing was analyzed using technique of composite index and GIS technology.The results showed that:(1)The spatial distribution of agricultural ecological security in Chongqing is very imbalance,The level of agricultural ecological security was decreasing from Chongqing metropolitan area to the direction of northeast and southeast overall,barrier effects of industrial pollution are more obvious;(2)The spatial concentration pattern of agricultural ecological security in Chongqing tend to polarization,was good the better and worse then the worse;(3) The Moran I of agricultural ecological security in Chongqing changes in different scales,the agricultural eco-system has good spatial autocorrelation within the threshold of 70km.This paper put forward the relevant policies and proposals to the problems,the study has a great significance for the optimal allocation of regional agricultural resources and guiding agricultural development planning.

ABnafTcJ.title: Anti-myocardial ischaemic effect of pseudoginsenoside F11 by inhibiting expression of beta1-adrenoceptor in rats with coronary artery ligation
ABnafTcJ.abstract: Abstract   The anti-myocardial ischaemic effect of pseudoginsenoside F11 (PF 11 ), a characteristic constituent of American ginseng, was evaluated in rats with coronary artery ligation. Both data and histopathological examination demonstrated that intragastric administration of PF 11  at doses of 6 and 12 mg/kg could significantly improve heart function and decrease infarct size. Meanwhile, the levels of creatine kinase (CK), lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), aspartate transaminase (AST), malondialdehyde (MDA), and cardiac troponin T (cTnT) decreased, while the activity of superoxide dismutase (SOD) increased. Flow cytometry and western blotting were used to explore the underlying mechanism, and results showed that the expression of beta1-adrenoceptor (β1-AR) was decreased by PF 11 . Furthermore, Glide XP software (Schrodinger) for molecular docking unravelled the probable binding sites between PF 11  and β1-AR. This study provides substantial evidence for the effect of PF 11  on myocardial ischaemia, and indicates that PF 11  might be a potential dietary supplement for treatment of myocardial ischaemia injury.

ZKuydxip.title: ASSESSMENT OF URBAN ECOSYSTEM HEALTH IN THE NAN'AN DISTRICT OF CHONGQING BASED ON ATTRIBUTE HIERARCHY-RECOGNITION MODEL
ZKuydxip.abstract: From the viewpoint of complex ecosystem,an assessment index system of urban ecosystem health was constracted,and an attribute synthetic assessment model was established based on the attribute hierarchy-recognize model.Taking the Nan′an District of Chongqing as an example,we use the models and methods to make evaluation for urban ecosystem in the Nan′an District of Chongqing.The results show that the current situation of the ecosystem in the Nan′an District of Chongqing belongs to sub-health.In accordance with the results of the evaluation,it analyzes the health evaluation attribute index of the Nan′an District of Chongqing.It shows that the Nan′an ecosystem is in transition phase with a number of limiting factors of health.In order to guide a healthy urban ecosystem development,it must rely on scientific and rational method of planning and implementation.From a long-term consideration,in order to improve the urban ecosystem health,corresponding control measures and methods were put forward.

mym6gavv.title: Self-assembly synthesis of cactuslike Cu2O 3D nanoarchitectures via a low-temperature solution approach
mym6gavv.abstract: Cu 2 O nanocactuses were synthesized via a simple, low-temperature, and no time-consuming wet chemical route. The synthesized products were systematically studied by X-ray powder diffraction, scanning electron microscopy, and transmission electron microscopy. The results showed that the formation of Cu 2 O nanocactuses was strongly depended on the addition of CTAB and NaOH. The structural evolution of the cactuslike Cu 2 O was found to follow dissolution and recrystallization processes. It is noteworthy that the stepwise synthetic procedure was crucial to the growth of the final nanoarchitectures. UV–vis spectrum was also used to estimate the absorption and photodegradation ability of the nanocactuses.

6xpiobXI.title: Numerical Simulation of Performance of Fin-and-tube Condenser with Different Structural Arrangement in Air-conditioning System
6xpiobXI.abstract: The effect of branch number and tube row number on heat transfer coefficient and flow characteristic under the condition of the same geometry size of condenser,air inlet temperature and flow rate was analyzed.The results show that pressure drop decreases as branch number increases,the maximum pressure drop is 159 times as big as the minimum pressure drop;the total heat transfer coefficient and heat transfer rate of condenser decreases as temperature difference between air and refrigerant increases,the maximum heat transfer rate is 32.1% greater than the minimum one;pressure drop increases as tube row number increases and the pressure drop of 4 row tubes is 4.3 times as big as 1 row tubes;heat transfer coefficient at the air side shows an opposite trend with that at the refrigerant side,but heat transfer rate increases when temperature difference increases,heat transfer rate of 4 rows tubes is 2.45 times as big as that of 1 row tubes.

sqQN0kmg.title: Hydrothermal synthesis of novel Zn2SnO4 octahedron microstructures assembled with hexagon nanoplates
sqQN0kmg.abstract: Zn 2 SnO 4 with novel octahedron structures have been successfully synthesized on a large scale by applying surfactant hexadecyl trimethyl ammonium bromide (CTAB) throughout controllable hydrothermal reaction. X-ray diffraction (XRD), scanning electron microcopy (SEM), transmission electron microscopy (TEM), and high-resolution transmission electron microscopy (HRTEM) were used to characterize the final products. The results have revealed that three-dimensional (3D) Zn 2 SnO 4 octahedrons were assembled with numerous intercrossed hexagon nanoplates with a mean edge length of 300 nm and an average thickness of 50 nm. Based on the time-dependent experimental results, the growth mechanism has been thoroughly investigated. The morphology of as-prepared octahedrons evolved from cubes with branched structures on their surfaces to octahedrons assembled with hexagon nanoplates, indicating that the process of crystal growth was controlled by a crystallization–dissolution–recrystallization growth mechanism. More importantly, we found that CTAB played a key role during the total formation process of as-obtained Zn 2 SnO 4 octahedrons. UV–vis spectroscopy was further employed to estimate the band gap energy of the octahedron microstructures. Keywords Semiconductors Crystal growth Optical properties

pIpydwEb.title: Development and validation of a direct passage arrangement method for multistream plate fin heat exchangers
pIpydwEb.abstract: Abstract   Passage arrangement quality significantly affects the performance of multistream plate fin heat exchanger (MPFHEs) because a bad arrangement may result in uneven temperature difference field and pressure field between passages and thus reduce the thermal efficiency. However, it is very difficult to design an effective passage arrangement owing to large numbers of possible passage arrangement patterns and complex heat transfer processes between the passages in a MPFHE. This work develops a direct passage arrangement method for MPFHEs to address this problem. In this method, an improvement of passage arrangement with good synergistic heat transfer effect is first proposed. The determination of passage quantity for each fluid is suggested to be proportional to its design heat load. Next, based on the results of the checking calculation, the fin and heat exchanger structure parameters should be adjusted until the constraints including thermal effectiveness, length deviation and pressure drops have been satisfied. Afterwards, the passages are arranged directly by a symmetry arrangement method. To evaluate the effectiveness of this method, three different industrial cases are performed and compared with the existing optimization designs by three evaluation means. The validation results indicate that this method performs better than the complex optimization methods.

QPyUHipU.title: Effects of 3 Kinds of Fungicides on Stem Rot of Elymus sibiricus L. in the Seedling Stage
QPyUHipU.abstract: 3 kinds of fungicides(Shilefu,Tachigaren,Genfujing) with different concentrations were sprayed on Elymus sibiricus L.cv.Chuancao No.2 in the seedling stage.After half a month,the plant density,survival rate and growth index was measured and analysed.The results showed at in seedling stage,the stem rot incidence rate and mortality rate of E.sibiricus reached 78.54% and 24.96%,respectively.And the disease index was 53.09.As to Shilefu,different concentrations significantly affected the density and survival rate(P<0.01);to Tachigaren,the stem rot of E.sibiricus of all treatment was controled and treat concentration had a significant effect on leaf length(P<0.01).But Genfujing only had a non-significant influence on the density and survival rate.In short,Shilefu,Tachigaren had better effect to control stem rot of E.sibiricus than Genfujing.And 2 000 or 2 500 times dilution of Shilefu,2 000 and 3 000 times dilution of Tachigaren may be applied in practice.

3qVmuNVR.title: A non-polarity flexible asymmetric supercapacitor with nickel nanoparticle@ carbon nanotube three-dimensional network electrodes
3qVmuNVR.abstract: Abstract   Asymmetric supercapacitors are one of the promising next-generation electrochemical energy storage devices. However, the necessity to distinguish the polarity of asymmetric supercapacitors makes it more like rechargeable batteries and affects the convenience of practical applications. We herein report a novel flexible asymmetric supercapacitor (FASC) that can be charged without distinguishing the electrode polarity based on CVD-grown nickel nanoparticle@carbon nanotube (Ni@CNT) network films. The FASC is assembled by using the binder-free Ni@CNT as both the negative and positive electrodes but aqueous alkaline solution as the electrolyte. In such a design, one electrode side is involved with the Faradaic redox reactions between nickel nanoparticles and OH - , while the other side works via electric double layer charge accumulation at the interface of CNTs/electrolyte, enabling the device with an asymmetric feature and a high voltage of 1.8 V. Exactly because of the above, the FASC demonstrates almost the same charge/discharge profiles, stable cycling and comparable efficiency for powering small electronics even with frequently alternating the charging direction. With the integration of hydrogel electrolyte of PVA-KOH, our flexible quasi-solid-state FASC device delivers high volumetric energy density of 1.39 mWh cm −3  and power density of 440 mW cm −3 , as well as excellent cycleability up to 10,000 times (100% capacitance retention). The volumetric performance is even much better than previous reported FASC devices that were designed with complicated electrode architectures. Our work presents a pioneering strategy for developing non-polarity asymmetric electrochemical energy storage systems.

Kj2bdmah.title: Protection in mice immunized with recombinant expressing TgSAG1 against Toxoplasma gondii challenge
Kj2bdmah.abstract: Objective To evaluate the protective effect against Toxoplasma gondii in mouse hypodermic immunization with recombination Toxoplasma gondii SAG1(rTgSAG1)protein. Methods Sixty 6-week-old BALB/c mice were randomly divided into five groups,12 mice per group.Mice were hypodermically immunized with 100 μl PBS,20 μg,40 μg,60 μg and 80 μg rTgSAG1(dissolved in 100 μl PBS),respectively.Two boosters were carried out at 2-week intervals.On day 14 after the last immunization,all mice were intragastrically challenged with 1×104 tachyzoites per mouse,and the health status of infected mice was recorded every day after challenged.On day 28 after challenge,survival mice were killed.The tachyzoites of their livers and brains and the lymphocytes of spleens and intraepithelial lymphocytes(IEL)were counted,respectively,and serum IgG and IgA in intestinal washes were detected by ELISA. Results On day 6-14 after challenge,mice showed clothing hair rough at different degrees,decrease of foraging and drinking water.The survival rate was the lowest in PBS group(33.3%),but the highest(75%)in 40 μg dose group.The tachyzoite loads in 40 μg dose group in livers(79.60)and brains(16.88)were significantly lower than that in PBS group(94.43,19.48)(P<0.05).The number of splenic lymphocyte(10.31)and IEL(4.25)in 40 μg group were significantly higher than that in PBS group(6.24,1.64)(P<0.01).The levels of IgG in 40 μg group(P<0.01),20 μg and 60 μg groups(P<0.05)were significantly higher than that in PBS group respectively.The level of IgA had no marked change. Conclusion The protective immunity against Toxoplasma gondii in mouse hypodermic immunization with rTgSAG1 could be induced,and 40 μg is the best immunizing dose.

ROHWGucw.title: Features of alfalfa production in humid area of subtropical zone in Sichuan
ROHWGucw.abstract: Based on the analysis of the characteristics of climate,soil and topography in the humid area of subtropical zone of Sichuan Province,the main constraints for alfalfa production were pointed out.The suggestions for improving alfalfa production were provided.These suggestions were to breed new cultivars which could tolerance humid,heat and acid environments.Meanwhile,the field management should be improved in order to increase the yield per unit area.As to the utilization of alfalfa,it should be utilized as forage crop,combined with vegetable crop and honey-source crop so that the greater economic profit could be achieved and the constraints could be resolved.

lF1tAHko.title: Texture Pattern Classification via Weibull Distribution-based Image Statistical Modeling *
lF1tAHko.abstract: A novel image texture pattern classification (ITPC) method based on statistical modeling of image spatial structures (ISSs) is presented due to the perceptual perspective that the visual appearance of image texture pattern (ITP) visually depends on the random organization of local homogeneous fragments. Firstly, the oriented Gaussian derivative filters (OGDFs)-based ISS characteristics expression method is introduced. Then, the Weibull distribution (WD) behavior of ISSs, boiled down to the randomly-distributed local homogeneous fragments, is explicated by the sequential fragmentation theory (SFT). Finally, the WD-based ISS feature parameters, directly related to the human vision perception(HVP) system, are extracted and used to ITPC by a partial least squares-discriminant analysis (PLS-DA)-based classifier. The effectiveness of the proposed ISS-based ITPC method is verified by extensive experiments on three different texture image databases and compared with some classic statistics-based ITP identification methods.

f4EWHEj4.title: Perioperative Outcomes of Using Different Temperature Management Strategies on Pediatric Patients Undergoing Aortic Arch Surgery: A Single-Center, 8-Year Study.
f4EWHEj4.abstract: With the widespread application of regional low-flow perfusion (RLFP), development of surgical techniques, and shortened circulatory arrest time, deep hypothermia is indispensable for organ protection. Clinicians have begun to increase the temperature to reduce hypothermia-related adverse outcomes. The aim of this study was to evaluate the safety and efficacy of elevated temperatures during aortic arch surgery with lower body circulatory arrest (LBCA) combined with RLFP.  We retrospectively analyzed data from 207 consecutive pediatric patients who underwent aortic arch repair with LBCA & RLFP between January 2010 and July 2017 and evaluated different hypothermia management strategies. The overall cohort was divided into three groups: deep hypothermia (DH, 20.0-25.0°C), moderate hypothermia (MoH, 25.1-30.0°C) and mild hypothermia (MH, 30.1-34.0°C).  The percentage of AKI-1 occurrences was significantly increased in the MH group (51.52%) compared to those in the DH (25.40%) and MoH (37.84%) groups ( = 0.036); prolonged hospital stay occurrences were decreased with elevated temperature (DH 47.62%, MoH 28.83%, MH 18.18%,  = 0.006). Neurological complications, peritoneal dialysis, hepatic dysfunction, 30-day hospital mortality, delay extubation occurrences were no significant among the groups. Logistic analysis showed that the MH group was negatively associated with post-op AKI-1 compared with the DH group [ = 0.329 (0.137-0.788),  = 0.013], no differences were found between the MoH and the MH group. Compared to other groups, the intubation time ( = 0.006) and postoperative hospital stay ( = 0.009) were significantly decreased in the MH group. Multivariate logistic analysis showed hypothermia levels were not significant with prolonged hospital stay.  This retrospective analysis demonstrated that for pediatric patients undergoing surgeries with RLFP & LBCA, three different gradient temperature management strategies are available: deep, moderate, and mild hypothermia. Utilizing mild or moderate hypothermia is safe and feasible. Although the number of AKI-1 occurrences in the MH group was significantly increased compared to those in the other groups, further analysis showed no significance in the MoH and MH group, mild hypothermia management is as safe as others when used appropriately.

lKfPf8MZ.title: Ecosystem health evaluation of Three Gorges reservoir area (Chongqing) based on the theory of maximum entropy and grey system
lKfPf8MZ.abstract: The Three Gorges reservoir area (Chongqing) is a typical channel reservoir,an ecologically fragile zone,and relatively poor in its natural ecosystem conditions. To promote sustainable development in the reservoir area and protection of its ecological security,the ecosystem's health status and its stress factors need to be clarified. According to the characteristics of the local ecological system,a natural-social-economic health evaluation index system of the complex ecosystem was constructed. And on the basis of the grey system theory,the Jaynes maximum entropy principle in information theory was introduced to evaluate the ecosystem health of the Three Gorges reservoir area (Chongqing) . The results show that the Three Gorges reservoir area (Chongqing) ecosystem remains in a transitional stage of rapid change. The functions of production,regulation and services are significantly different. The health condition of the eastern section of the Three Gorges reservoir area (Chongqing) ecosystem is better than the western section,but the interior of the eastern ecosystem is apparently different and has complex structure. Corresponding measures are proposed to solve the problems above.

TU6qhRJ9.title: Ulinastatin Protects against Acute Kidney Injury in Infant Piglets Model Undergoing Surgery on Hypothermic Low-Flow Cardiopulmonary Bypass
TU6qhRJ9.abstract: ObjectiveInfants are more vulnerable to kidney injuries induced by inflammatory response syndrome and ischemia-reperfusion injury following cardiopulmonary bypass especially with prolonged hypothermic low-flow (HLF). This study aims to evaluate the protective role of ulinastatin, an anti-inflammatory agent, against acute kidney injuries in infant piglets model undergoing surgery on HLF cardiopulmonary bypass.

M5HV8iUo.title: Preliminary study on capitalized operation of abandoned mine lands
M5HV8iUo.abstract: In order to realize market-oriented operation for regulation and utilization of abandoned mine lands and solve financial difficulties,capitalized operation of abandoned mine lands is put forward.This paper firstly discusses feasibility and connotation of capitalized operation of abandoned mine lands,and then summarizes approaches of capitalized operation of abandoned mine lands on the basis of practice.The results show that capitalized operation of abandoned mine lands has theoretical and practical basis,so it is feasible to start the capitalized operation.There are also some approaches in practice,namely recovery mining,adopting land utilization patterns of high economic benefit,and land replacement mechanism.Finally,some suggestions are proposed aiming to boost capitalized operation of abandoned mine lands.

g7tE6nk8.title: Research on key parameters of die rolling thread shaft in cross wedge rolling
g7tE6nk8.abstract: The forming theory of rolling thread shaft in cross wedge rolling and ascertaining tooth height of die is important to die design.Provided that when parts were processed,the metal volume theory was kept invariable,the tooth height of die and the roller diameter initial value were calculated by math integral.Thus the type of die groove was designed.Using the finite element DEFORM-3D software to simulate the rolling process,better perfect trapezoid thread shaft was processed.The result validates the feasibility of rolling thread shaft in cross wedge rolling whose die is designed by using the tooth height value,which provides the theoretical foundation and reference worth for farther research.

HC6G3NCo.title: Protective effects of sesquiterpenoids from the root of Panax Ginseng on fulminant liver injury induced by lipopolysaccharide/D-galactosamine.
HC6G3NCo.abstract: It is reported sesquiterpenoids from Panax ginseng (SPG) possess various pharmacological activities, for example, antidepressant, antioxidative and antiinflammatory. The purpose of this study was to examine the hepatoprotective effects of SPG (2.5 and 10 mg/kg, i.g.) on fulminant liver injury induced by D-galactosamine (D-GalN) and lipopolysaccharide (LPS) and discuss its mechanisms of action. 24 h after D-GalN (400 mg/kg, i.p.) and LPS (25 μg/kg, i.p.) exposed, the serum levels of alanine transaminase (ALT) and aspartate transaminase (AST), hepatic malondialdehyde (MDA) level, hepatic activities of superoxide dismutase (SOD), catalase (CAT) and glutathione (GSH), and hepatic tissue histology were measured. Expression levels of tumor necrosis factor-α (TNF-α) and interleukin-1 beta (IL-1β) were detected by ELISA and RT-PCR. Moreover, the nuclear factor-κB (NF-κB), nuclear factor erythroid 2-related factor 2 (Nrf2), sirtuin type 1 (Sirt 1) and heme oxygenase 1 (HO-1) were determined by western blotting. The results indicated that SPG evidently restrained the increasement of serum ALT and AST levels induced by D-GalN/LPS. SPG obviously down-regulated TNF-α and IL-1β levels and their mRNA expression in liver. In addition, D-GalN/LPS injection induced severe oxidative stress in liver by boosted MDA level as well as decreased CAT, GSH and SOD capacities, and SPG reversed these changes. Meanwhile, SPG inhibited NF-κB activation induced by D-GalN/LPS and up-regulation Sirt 1, Nrf2 and HO-1 expression levels. Therefore, SPG might protect against the fulminant liver injury induced by D-GalN/LPS via inhibiting inflammation and oxidative stress. The protective effect of SPG on fulminant liver injury induced by D-GalN/LPS might be mediated by Sirt 1/Nrf2/NF-κB signaling pathway. All these results implied that SPG might be a promising food additives and therapeutic agent for fulminant liver injury.

9KeY0aZy.title: Morphology control and transition of ZnO nanorod arrays by a simple hydrothermal method
9KeY0aZy.abstract: ZnO nanorod arrays with different morphologies have been synthesized on the zinc foil via a simple hydrothermal method which is both a convenient and inexpensive process. The key influencing factors including the solution concentration and the reaction time are all studied and compared carefully. Based on our investigation, it is found that the morphologies of ZnO crystals could be controlled and the transition of different morphologies is also realized successfully with the growing reaction time. Furthermore, the as-grown ZnO nanorods are single crystalline with a wurtzite structure. Finally, a reasonable mechanism to explain the different crystal morphologies is also discussed in detail.

oSt7ySNw.title: Research on Necessity and Feasibility for Emergency Reserve of Electric Coal in China
oSt7ySNw.abstract: China is a high-energy consumption country and its power is mainly from the thermal power.So electric coal consumption is a major part of coal consumption.Because of unexpected natural disasters and seasonal changes in demand and price fluctuations and other factors,supply of electric coal will be a shortage in some local area and some special time.That causes heavy economic losses and seriously affects the security of energy applications.This paper discussed the connotation of emergency reserve of electric coal and related theories,forecast the demand of electric coal in China with grey prediction model and analyze the phenomenon of uneven distribution of coal with Gini Coefficient analysis,propose the necessity and feasibility of the establishment of coal in going deep into the foundation of analyzing the present status of coal supply and demand in China.

s882Oy6m.title: Large-scale synthesis of flower-like ZnO structures by a surfactant-free and low-temperature process
s882Oy6m.abstract: We have successfully synthesized self-organized radialized flower-like ZnO micron-crystals by employing Zn(NO 3 ) 2 ·6H 2 O, NH 3 ·H 2 O as the starting materials without surfactants, template supporting and structure-directing solvent at a low temperature (60 °C). Characterizations were carried out by X-ray diffraction (XRD), scanning electron microscopy (SEM), transmission electron microscopy (TEM) and room temperature photoluminescence (PL) measurements. A possible growth mechanism, the influence of pH value on the formation of crystalline ZnO and the photoluminescence properties of flower-like ZnO are systematically discussed.

oPU3Cv4d.title: Clinical Experience of 39 Patients Managed by Extracorporeal Membrane Oxygenation
oPU3Cv4d.abstract: Objective:Retrospectively summarized and analysed the data of 39 consecutive extracorporeal membrane oxygenation(ECMO)cases performed in Fuwai Hospital.Methods:Reviewed the clinical protocols of 39 ECMO from Nov.2004 to Jun.2006 in Fuwai Hospital.The inter-surface of the ECMO equipment system was completely coated by heparin-coating technique.All patients were applied veno-artery ECMO and activated clotting time(ACT)was maintained between 120-160 sec and heparin usage dose was 5-20 U/(kg·h).Mean blood flow was 40-220 ml/(kg·min)during ECMO assistant period.Results:The shortest ECMO time was 11 hrs and the longest was 416 hrs with mean time was 99±62 hrs.Twenty-five patients(64.1%)weaned off successfully from ECMO.Twenty-one of them(84%)were discharged and 4 died of post-operative complications.Fourteen patients could not weaned off from ECMO.Total survival discharge rate was 53.8%.Conclusions:ECMO is an effective mechanical assistant therapy method for severe cardiac and pulmonary failure and it can be used as a bridge for heart transplantation to those with severe end-stage heart disorder.Opportunity and indications are the key point of success of ECMO.

N6iGTKhU.title: Synthesis and Visible-Light Photocatalytic Property of Bi 2 WO 6 Hierarchical Octahedron-Like Structures
N6iGTKhU.abstract:
A novel octahedron-like hierarchical structure of Bi2WO6 has been fabricated by a facile hydrothermal method in high quantity. XRD, SEM, TEM, and HRTEM were used to characterize
 the product. The results indicated that this kind of Bi2WO6 crystals had an average size of ~4 μm, constructed by quasi-square single-crystal nanosheets assembled in a special fashion.
 The formation of octahedron-like hierarchical structure of Bi2WO6 depended crucially on the pH value of the precursor suspensions. The photocatalytic activity of the hierarchical Bi2WO6 structures toward RhB degradation under visible light was investigated, and it was found to be significantly better than
 that of the sample fabricated by SSR. The better photocatalytic property should be strongly associated with the high specific
 surface area and the abundant pore structure of the hierarchical octahedron-like Bi2WO6.

S9SPiJub.title: The Simulation of Auto-Cascade Heat Pump Ssystem Based on Aspen Plus
S9SPiJub.abstract: The various condition characteristic has great influence on the performance of Auto-Cascade heat pump.By using Aspen-plus software,the heat pump at 4 different working conditions which condenser inlet water temperature ranges from 40 to 55℃ was simulated,the changing trend of parameters was analyzed,the flow situation of the expansion valves were analyzed by calculation.The results show that,when condenser inlet water temperature increases,the power consume of compressor and the flow rate ratio of main stream and sub-stream increases,the specific volume at suction of compressor decreases and the mass flow increases.Both two expansion valves haven't reached choked flow.

hJI5szhX.title: Diversity of population component and biomass structure for cloned Hemarthria compressa
hJI5szhX.abstract: The objectives of this study are to determine the quantitative,qualitative characters and biomass structure of population component for sixty cloned wild Hemarthria Compressa.The results showed that diversities existed among quantitative characters in the different population components.The coefficient of variation(CV) for leaf length,leaf width,leaf number of each tiller and leaf number of each cloned plant was 24.95%,20.00%,14.12%,43.56%,respectively.The CV for stem diameter,eustipes diameter,eustipes length,eustipes number of each tiller,the length and number of stem and stolon was 21.11%,22.42%,20.10%, 12.14%,46.73%,20.14%,72.76%,37.97%,respectively.The CV for root length,root distribution,roots area were 9.81%,37.65%,33.68%,respectively.The CV for the length,width and thickness of inflorescence,inflorescence number of each tiller,the ratio of stem to seminal branch and the ratio of stolon to seminal branch were 13.33%,13.42%,14.80%,36.10%,118.96%,81.44%,respectively.Meanwhile,the significant diversity for biomass structure in different population components in this study was found to be great.The CV of biomass for leaf,stem,root and inflorescence was 78.51%,91.66%,45.64%,192.24%,respectively.The genetic diversity among the ecotype and environmental suitability of these ecotypes are very beneficial for improved cultivars.

Wuxs5kao.title: A novel glucose sensor based on monodispersed Ni/Al layered double hydroxide and chitosan.
Wuxs5kao.abstract: A novel cheap and simple amperometric glucose biosensor, based on the electrode modified with the Ni/Al layered double hydroxide (LDH) nanoflakes and chitosan (CHT), without glucose oxidase, is presented. The glucose biosensor based on monodispersed high active Ni/Al-LDH nanoflakes and CHT exhibits an appropriate linear range of 0.01-10mM and good operational stability. The amperometric sensor shows a rapid response at the potential value 0.48V. In addition, optimization of the biosensor construction, the effects of the applied potential, the scan rate as well as common interfering compounds on the amperometric response and human serum samples analysis of the sensor were investigated and discussed.

IkUK38TP.title: Research of Vegetation Coverage Dynamic Changes in Shapingba District of Chongqing City
IkUK38TP.abstract: In this paper,vegetation dynamic changes in Shapingba District of Chongqing City were analyzed by making use of Erdas Imagine 8.7 and Arcgis 8.3 software on the base of TM images in 1993 and 2001.Firstly,TM image in 1993,2001 was geometrically corrected,which was based on 1∶5 digital terrain map and full Shapingba TM image gained;Next,vegetation index was calculated which was based on Band 3 and Band 4 of TM image,and degree of vegetation coverage was extracted according to NDVI based on the transformation model;Lastly,dynamic changes of vegetation in Shapingba District from 1993 to 2001 were analyzed.The research showed that vegetation coverage in Shapingba decreased.This result was due to fast urbanization,sharp population growth and excessive development.

bfJBLQ1e.title: Experimental study of an R290 split-type air conditioner using a falling film condenser
bfJBLQ1e.abstract: Abstract   R290 is one of the most promising refrigerants for split-type air conditioners (STAC) because of its excellent environmental and thermodynamic properties. However, R290 has flammability. There is necessary to improve the STAC design to reduce the refrigerant charge for the safety use. This work proposes a novel falling film condensing technology to address this problem. The novel condenser was setup on a STAC and tested in the standard psychrometric chamber. Experimental results show that using falling film condenser significantly reduces the refrigerant charge. The best performance is obtained with 290 g of R290 charge, for which the cooling capacity is 2690 W and the coefficient of performance (COP) is 3.55, meeting the safety and energy efficiency requirements. This result provides a new technical route for the application of an R290 STAC.

SYQcm8qD.title: Effect of Zero-Balanced Ultrafiltration on Procalcitonin and Respiratory Function after Extracorporeal Circulation
SYQcm8qD.abstract: OBJECTIVE To determine the effect of zero-balanced ultrafiltration(ZBUF) on procalcitonin(PCT) and respiratory function of infants with tetralogy of Fallot(TOF) after extracorporeal circulation(ECC).METHODS 20 infants with TOF undergoing open-heart surgical correction were assigned randomly to two groups.Trial group was given 50 ml/kg ZBUF and conventional ultrafiltration(CUF),while control group was given only CUF.Peri-operative plasma PCT and pulmonary function were monitored and compared.RESULTS PCT were decreased in trial group between 12 h and 48 h postoperatively but not reaching statistical significance. Trial group's pulmonary compliance was higher 12 h postoperatively(P<0.05). Oxygenation index were increased in trial group 0 and 12 h postoperatively(P>0.05).Intubation time was shorter in trail group(P<0.01).Positive correlation was found between PCT peak concentration and intubation time.CONCLUSION ZBUF is likely to decrease plasma PCT.ZBUF could improve ventilation and oxygenation,and shorten intubation time.Improved respiratory function may due to the lower plasma PCT.

3VrbskLj.title: A Study on the Realationship Between Urbanization Process and Changes of Water Resources Environment in Chongqing City
3VrbskLj.abstract: At the beginning of this paper,the author generally summarizes the current situation on domestic research of urbanization process and changes of water resources environment,and analyzes the current situation of water resource environment of Chongqing.At the same time,through analyzing the industrialization process,urbanization process and the evolution regulation of water environment in Chongqing,and dissects the coincident relationship between water environment and urbanization process in Chongqing,the author points out that water environment degeneration of Chongqing was formed by low quality of the structural weakness of industry,the lack of qualified energy and the extension of urban land.Lastly,according to the resources is afforded by the "eleven-five" plan of environmental protection in Chongqing.we can predict that the total need amount of water will be 14,553 million m~3 in 2030 year and the total amount of waste water exhausted will be added up to 2,530 million tons in 2010 year in Chongqing.

fZFLFUdP.title: Evaluation of the gastroprotective effects of 20 (S)-ginsenoside Rg3 on gastric ulcer models in mice
fZFLFUdP.abstract: Abstract   Background  Gastric ulcer (GU) is a common gastrointestinal disease that can be induced by many factors. Finding an effective treatment method that contains fewer side effects is important. 20 (S)-ginsenoside Rg3 is a kind of protopanaxadiol and has shown superior antiinflammatory and antioxidant effects in many studies, especially cancer studies. In this study, we examined the treatment efficacy of 20 (S)-ginsenoside Rg3 on GU.    Methods  Three kinds of GU models, including an alcohol GU model, a pylorus-ligated GU model, and an acetic acid GU model, were used. Mouse endothelin-1 (ET-1) and nitric oxide (NO) levels in blood and epidermal growth factor (EGF), superoxide dismutase, and NO levels in gastric mucosa were evaluated. Hematoxylin and eosin staining of gastric mucosa and immunohistochemical staining of ET-1, inducible nitric oxide synthase (NOS2), and epidermal growth factor receptors were studied. Ulcer index (UI) scores and UI ratios were also analyzed to demonstrate the GU conditions in different groups. Furthermore, Glide XP from Schrodinger was used for molecular docking to clarify the interactions between 20 (S)-ginsenoside Rg3 and EGF and NOS2.    Results  20 (S)-ginsenoside Rg3 significantly decreased the UI scores and UI ratios in all the three GU models, and it demonstrated antiulcer effects by decreasing the ET-1 and NOS2 levels and increasing the NO, superoxide dismutase, EGF, and epidermal growth factor receptor levels. In addition, high-dose 20 (S)-ginsenoside Rg3 showed satisfactory gastric mucosa protection effects.    Conclusion  20 (S)-ginsenoside Rg3 can inhibit the formation of GU and may be a potential therapeutic agent for GU.

HXytP5ca.title: Decision Strategy and Decision Theory under the Time Pressure
HXytP5ca.abstract: Decision action under the time pressure is one of the hot topics in the psychological research field.Time pressure is the individual psychological state or emotional experience of time constraint,which is the responsive reaction for the time constraint.Decision strategy under the time pressure is classified as decision results and decision process.Decision theory under the time pressure include: cost/benefit theory;image theory;differentiation and consolidation theory;effort/accuracy tradeoff mode.

G3Us0OAU.title: Analysis of the best production condition of cleaner froth in bauxite flotation process based on froth texture coarseness measurement
G3Us0OAU.abstract: In order to achieve the automatic monitoring and intelligent evaluation of the bauxite flotation process, a method of analyzing and selecting the best production condition of the cleaner froth based on machine vision is presented. Firstly, the roughness feature of froth surface texture is extracted based on the improved local binary pattern(LBP) operator. Then, the best roughness interval of the cleaner froth texture feature in the flotation production process is obtained through analyzing the relation between the flotation concentrate grade and the extracted surface texture features of the cleaner froth image. This method can monitor the change of the texture feature of the cleaner froth image in real time and automatically identify whether the cleaning process is under the best production condition, which lays the foundation of the optimal control of the bauxite flotation process.

vpxjbPk2.title: Studies on the Chemical Constituents from Agrimonia pilosa Leseb.and Its Pharmacological Activities
vpxjbPk2.abstract: Objective To study the chemical constituents from Agrimonia pilosa Ledeb.and its pharmacological activities.Methods The constituents were isolated and repeatedly purified on silica gel column chromatography and their structures were elucidated by spectral analysis.Use drug-diluted Lowenstein-Jensen agar medium to determine MIC in vitro.Resullts Apigenin-7-0-methyl glucuronate(Ⅰ) and Apigenin-7-0-butyl glucuronate(Ⅱ) were isolated from Agrimonia pilosa Ledeb.The pharmacological activities of the extraction parts with three methods from the agrimonia pilosa Ledeb.were studied.The results showed that three kinds of the extractions could inhibit the growing of streptococcus pheumonia,Escherichia coli,staphylococcus epidermidis,streptococcus pheumonia,Pseudomonas aeyuginosa,salmonella typhi etc,especially of Staphylococcus auresu in vitro.Concusion Apigenin-7-0-butyl glucuronate(Ⅱ) is a new compound.Results of experiments of compounds Agrimoniapilosa Leseb.vitro showed effectively antituberculosis.

L8d32n35.title: Histidine-tryptophan-ketoglutarate solution with added ebselen augments myocardial protection in neonatal porcine hearts undergoing ischemia/reperfusion.
L8d32n35.abstract: Whether modified histidine-tryptophan-ketoglutarate (HTK) solution offers myocardial protection to newborn heart has not been documented. The purpose of this study was to compare myocardial protection using HTK added by ebselen with HTK in a piglet model of cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB). Fifteen piglets were randomly assigned to three groups: the control group (C group, n = 5), HTK solution group (HTK group, n = 5), and HTK added by 10 nM ebselen group (HTK+E group, n = 5). Animals in the two experimental groups were placed on hypothermic CPB, after which the ascending aorta had been clamped for 2 h. The control animals underwent normothermic CPB without cardiac arrest. Myocardial antioxidant activities, myocytes apoptosis and mitochondrial structures, as well as the release of cytochrome c and the expression of Bax, Bcl-2, and HSP72 protein in myocardium were measured. Increased myocardial superoxide dismutase (SOD) and Mn-SOD activities, decreased TUNEL-positive cells, and reduced release of cytochrome c were noted in the HTK+E group compared with those in the HTK group (P = 0.021, P = 0.020, P = 0.045, and P = 0.010, respectively). The Bax/Bcl-2 ratio in the HTK group was significantly higher than that in the C group (P = 0.024). The expression of HSP72 protein and mRNA in the HTK+E group was higher than that in the HTK group (P = 0.039 and P = 0.035, respectively). Mitochondrial score under electron microscope in the HTK+E group was lower than that in the HTK group (P = 0.047). Improved antioxidant defense, reduced myocytes apoptosis, and better preserved mitochondrial structure were observed in the HTK+E group. Ebselen added to HTK provides better myocardioprotection to HTK solution for the neonatal heart.

3gGeiVMJ.title: Chiisanoside, a triterpenoid saponin, exhibits anti-tumor activity by promoting apoptosis and inhibiting angiogenesis
3gGeiVMJ.abstract: The leaves of the Acanthopanax species have traditionally been used as a tonic and sedative, as well as in the treatment of rheumatism and diabetes, and one of their main active ingredients is a lupane triterpenoid chiisanoside which exhibits a series of significant pharmacological effects. However, the anti-tumor activity of chiisanoside on H22 hepatocellular carcinoma and the pharmacokinetics study have not been mentioned. The aim of this study was to explore the anti-tumor efficacy, the potential mechanisms in a H22 tumor-bearing mice model, and the pharmacokinetics properties and tissue distribution characteristics in a rat model. The results revealed that chiisanoside exhibited significant inhibition of tumor cell growth with no side effects on immune organs. The plasma cytokine levels of IL-2, TNF-α, and IFN-γ were enhanced, whereas the plasma VEGF level was decreased after chiisanoside treatment. Moreover, the results of Hu0026E, TUNEL assay, immunohistochemistry showed that chiisanoside exhibited antitumor activity in vivo by promoting apoptosis and inhibiting angiogenesis. Additionally, further investigations on the pharmacokinetics revealed that chiisanoside had a trait of fast absorption and rapid elimination in rat. Furthermore, the results of tissue distribution showed that chiisanoside was mainly distributed in the liver, small intestine and other organs in rat, which indicated that chiisanoside exhibited good liver and small intestine-targeting efficiency.

SRWgazC5.title: Differential Regulation of N-Methyl-D-Aspartate Receptor Subunits is an Early Event in the Actions of Soluble Amyloid-β(1-40) Oligomers on Hippocampal Neurons.
SRWgazC5.abstract: Synaptic dysfunction during early stages of Alzheimeru0027s disease (AD) is triggered by soluble amyloid-β (Aβ) oligomers that interact with NMDA receptors (NMDARs). We previously showed that Aβ induces synaptic protein loss through NMDARs, albeit through undefined mechanisms. Accordingly, we here examined the contribution of individual NMDAR subunits to synaptotoxicity and demonstrate that Aβ exerts differential effects on the levels and distribution of GluN2A and GluN2B subunits of NMDAR in dendrites. Treatment of cultured hippocampal neurons with Aβ1-40 (10 μM, 1 h) induced a significant increase of dendritic and synaptic GluN2B puncta densities with parallel decreases in the puncta densities of denritic and synaptic pTyr1472-GluN2B. Conversely, Aβ significantly decreased dendritic and synaptic GluN2A and dendritic pTyr1325-GluN2A puncta densities and increased synaptic pTyr1325-GluN2A puncta densities. Unexpectedly, Aβ treatment resulted in a significant reduction of GluN2B and pTyr1472-GluN2B protein levels but did not influence GluN2A and pTyr1325-GluN2A levels. These results show that Aβ exerts complex and distinct regulatory effects on the trafficking and phosphorylation of GluN2A and GluN2B, as well as on their localization within synaptic and non-synaptic sites. Increased understanding of these early events in Aβ-induced synaptic dysfunction is likely to be important for the development of timely preventive and therapeutic interventions.

y8AkDGoR.title: Development of forming die and process for wedge rolling acme threaded shaft
y8AkDGoR.abstract: The design method of a die for wedge rolling an acme threaded shaft was stated.The die is composed of preparative billet sections and threaded sections.The preparative billet sections include wedge section,spread section and arc finishing section.The die groove in the threaded section was designed based on the volume invariability theory of the metal that is wedged in and extruded out the shaft when the shaft is processed;and with the die's tooth tip width and lateral wall field angle staying invariable.The rolling process was simulated by finite element software DEFORM-3D,verifying the feasibility of rolling acme threaded shaft in dies.The design method provides theoretical basis and reference to the study of wedge rolling threaded shafts.

7QXWicsR.title: A novel and stable "two-hit" acute lung injury model induced by oleic acid in piglets
7QXWicsR.abstract: BACKGROUND: Children are susceptible to pulmonary injury, and acute lung injury (ALI) often results in a high mortality and financial cost in pediatric patients. Evidence has showed that oleic acid (OA) plays an important role in ALI. Therefore, it has special significance to study ALI in pediatric patients by using OA-induced animal models. Unfortunately, the animal model hs a high mortality due to hemodynamic instability. The aim of this study was to establish a novel hemodynamically stable OA-induced ALI model in piglets with two hits. METHODS: 18 Chinese mini-piglets were randomized into three groups: group C (received saline-ethanol solution), group T (received OA-ethanol solution in routine administration manner) and group H (received OA-ethanol solution in two-hit manner). Hemodynamic and pulmonary function data were measured. Histopathological assessments were performed. RESULTS: Two piglets in group T died of radical decline of systemic blood pressure. Group T showed more drastic hemodynamic changes than group H especially during the period of 5 to 30 minutes after OA administration. Both Group T and group H all produced severe lung injury, while group C had no significant pathologic changes. OA-induced hypotension might be caused by pulmonary hypertension rather than comprised left ventricular function. CONCLUSION: OA leads to severe pulmonary hypertension which results in hemodynamic fluctuation in OA-induced ALI model. It is the first report on hemodynamic stable ALI animal model in piglets using two-hit method. The two-hit ALI animal model fulfils the ALI criteria and has the following characteristics: hemodynamic stability, stable damage to gas exchange and comparability with pediatric patients in body weight and corresponding age. The two-hit ALI animal model can be used to study the basic mechanism and the therapeutic strategies for pediatric ALI.

sdPz59GW.title: A Research on the Risk Perception of Urban Inhabitants
sdPz59GW.abstract: To explore the structure of the risk perception of urban inhabitants,we developed a survey questionnaire of risk perception including 23 items.Exploratory Factor Analysis(EFA) shows that their risk perception contains five factors:controllability,visibility,fearfulness,possibility and severity of risk,which can explain 54.775% of the whole variance.Reliability tests show that the a coefficient is from 0.5799 to 0.8527 and the split-half reliability is from 0.5352 to 0.8420,the correlation coefficient between factors and summation is higher than that between factors,all with statistical prominence.The reliability and validity of the questionnaire are excellent.The Confirmatory Factor Analysis(CFA) of data from another sample confirmed the factor validity of this questionnaire.

qlmEaJeG.title: Ni/Al layered double hydroxide nanosheet film grown directly on Ti substrate and its application for a nonenzymatic glucose sensor
qlmEaJeG.abstract: Ni/Al layered double hydroxide nanosheet film has been successfully fabricated on a Ti substrate by a single coprecipitation method. After the hydrothermal process, the Ti foil modified with Ni/Al layered double hydroxide nanosheet film can be directly used as the working electrode of a nonenzymatic glucose sensor. Low detection limit of 5 μM with an appropriate linear range up to 10.0 mM ( R = 0.99972) can be obtained and the sensitivity is 24.45 μAm M −1 cm −2 . The good analytical performance, low cost and one-step preparation method make this electrode material promising for the development of a nonenzymatic glucose sensor. Keywords Ni/Al layered double hydroxide Nanosheet film Nonenzymatic glucose biosensor Glucose determination 1 Introduction Layered double hydroxides (LDHs), with a brucite-like layered structure, are a family of synthetic anionic clays that consist of positively charged layers containing alternatively distributed divalent and trivalent cations in the sheets and charge balancing anions between the layers [1] . They are expressed by the general formula, [ M 1 − x II M x III ( OH ) 2 ] x + ⋅ A x / n n − ⋅ m H 2 O , where M 2+ and M 3+ represent divalent and trivalent metal cations respectively, and A n − is the interlayer anions [2] . Their remarkable features such as the layered structure, large surface area and anion exchange capability make them attractive as electrode surface modification materials in electrochemistry [3–5] . Among these LDHs, Ni-based LDHs which mean the divalent metal cation is Ni 2+ have received more attention because of their potential application in electrochemical biosensors. It could be attributed to two main characters of Ni-based LDHs. Like other members of LDHs, the positively charged layers are convenient for the adsorption of negatively charged biomolecules such as enzymes [6] , amino acids [7] , DNA [8] . Therefore, some electrochemical biosensors based on Ni-based LDHs as the supporting matrix of enzymes have been successfully developed [9] . On the other hand, the Ni 2+ cation in the host layers is electrochemically active. The unique electrocatalytic effect mediated by Ni 2+ /Ni 3+ redox couples in alkaline circumstance is very useful in the determination of glucose [10] , thus the nonenzymatic glucose biosensors based on the Ni-based LDHs have also been developed in recent years [11] . In order to enhance the analytical performance of these nonenzymatic glucose biosensors based on the Ni-based LDHs, some effective techniques have been used to deposit Ni-based LDHs onto various substrates. An important example was demonstrated in 2002 by Roto and Villemure that the presynthesized Ni/Al layered double hydroxide (Ni/Al-LDH) powder can be immobilized onto the ITO or glassy carbon electrode surface with the help of silica gel [12] . Similar results were obtained on silicon wafers and porous Ni foams substrate when the silica gel was replaced by dry organic solvents or polytetrafluoroethylene [13,14] . An advanced synthetic strategy has been developed by the direct electrodeposition of Ni/Al-LDH on conductive substrates such as Au, Pt and glassy carbon electrode [15] . The oriented electrosynthesis of LDHs film on electrodes surface improves its adhesion to substrates and there is no need to transfer the as-prepared LDHs powder to a different surface or use other additives as binder. Following the strategy, Ni/Al-LDH film consisted of nanoparticles can be directly fabricated on the electrode surface by a simple way. In general, compared to spherical nanoparticles, well-aligned 2-D nanosheet film on conductive substrates are more attractive due to its promising applications in biosensor development. The interconnected structure is especially efficient for the transport of electrons and its high surface area-to-volume ratio could effectively increase the electrode–electrolyte contact area. As a result, to construct an ordered Ni/Al-LDH nanosheet film directly on conductive substrate will be very useful. Compared to other conductive substrates such as silicon wafer, ITO and graphite, metal substrates have received considerable attention because of their special properties. For example, good flexibility and high mechanical strength make them to be appropriate substrates to support other materials. In addition, most of metal materials are easy to be obtained with low cost and cut into various shapes at different sizes. These advantages open up the possibility of practicable applications of those electrodes based on metal substrates. The single preparation method of LDHs nanosheet films grown from active metal substrates like aluminum and zinc in alkaline solution have been reported [16,17] . However these metal substrates are too active to be the candidate for the electrode of electrochemistry. Therefore, an appropriate and relatively inert metal substrate should be found to fabricate electrocatalysts. Among inert metal substrates, noble metal electrodes such as Au and Pt electrode are favored in electrochemistry due to their good stability and excellent conductivity. Yet, these electrodes are usually expensive and need special polish before coating. Considering its excellent properties, like reasonable cost, good stability, high mechanical strength and wide electrochemical potential windows, Ti foil could be a good substitute of noble metal electrodes to support electrocatalysts [18] . For example, Koczkur et al. have reported nanoporous network Pt–Ir/Ti electrode via a one-step hydrothermal method [19] . Yi et al. have prepared titanium-supported nanoscale flaky nickel electrode by a hydrothermal process [20] . These results imply that Ti foil is not only stable enough to be employed as a novel substrate in electrochemistry, but also very suitable for the direct growth of electrocatalysts. Stimulated by these results and growing large-area uniform LDHs nanosheet film directly on Ti substrate has never been reported before, the Ni/Al-LDH nanosheet film grown directly on Ti foils was successfully synthesized in our laboratory. In this article, Ni/Al layered double hydroxide nanosheet film has been successfully fabricated on a Ti substrate by a single coprecipitation method. The fabrication process has the advantages of being very simple, cheap and mild. The direct growth of Ni/Al-LDH nanosheets on Ti foil considerably improves its mechanical stability, adhesion and conductivity to the substrate. The Ti foil modified with Ni/Al-LDH nanosheet can be directly used as the working electrode of a nonenzymatic glucose sensor. There is no need to use extra binders or other classical electrodes such as glassy carbon and Au electrode. The Ti foil acts as the conductive substrate supporting the interconnected Ni/Al-LDH nanosheets and the Ni 2+ cations in Ni/Al-LDH nanosheets play an essential role in the electrocatalytic detection of glucose. In application to electrochemistry, the new electrode exhibits high sensitivity, fast response, an appropriate linear range and good stability. The good analytical performance, low cost and one-step preparation method make this electrode material promising for the development of a nonenzymatic glucose sensor. 2 Experimental 2.1 Reagents All chemicals including nickel nitrate (Ni(NO 3 ) 2 ), aluminum nitrate (Al(NO 3 ) 3 ), urea ((NH 2 ) 2 CO), glucose (C 6 H 12 O 6 ), sodium hydroxide (NaOH) were analytical grade, and were used as received without further purification. All aqueous solutions were prepared in distilled water. The titanium foil was 99% purity. 2.2 Apparatus All electrochemical experiments were carried out by CHI 660C Electrochemical Work Station (CH Instrument Company of Shanghai, China). A conventional three-electrode system was adopted. The working electrode was a titanium foil modified with Ni/Al-LDH nanosheet film, the counter electrode was a Pt wire and the reference electrode was a saturate calomel electrode (SCE). All potential values given below were referred to the SCE. The geometric surface area of the working electrode is 0.8 cm 2 . The products were characterized using powder X-ray diffraction (Bruker D-8 Avance, Cu K α radiation, 1.5418 Å), Fourier transform infrared (FT-IR) spectra (NICOLET NEXUS470), transmission electron microscopy (TEM, JEM-2010FEF, 200 kV) and scanning electron microscopy (SEM, JSM-6700F, 5.0 kV). 2.3 Fabrication of Ti foil electrode modified with Ni/Al-LDH nanosheet film The Ni/Al-LDH nanosheet film grown directly on Ti Substrate was prepared by a single coprecipitation method. The typical procedures can be described as followed. Firstly, Ti foils were pretreated in the hydrofluoric acid solution to remove the oxides on their surfaces, and then rinsed with pure water. Secondly, a certain quality of nickel nitrate, aluminum nitrate and urea were dissolved in 70 ml distilled water to give the final concentrations of 0.10 mM, 0.05 mM and 0.5 mM respectively. Thirdly, the Ti foils were vertically put in the obtained mixed solution and the solution was aged at 95 °C for 24 h. Lastly, after the reaction completed, the Ti foils were washed with distilled water and ethanol several times, then dried at room temperature. In this way, Ni/Al-LDH nanosheet film could be fabricated on the Ti substrate by a very simple way with low cost. This opened up the possibility of large-scale production of the novel probe which can be applied as the electrode for a glucose sensor. 2.4 Electrochemical experiments The electrochemical behavior of the prepared electrode was investigated by cyclic voltammetry (CV) in a 0.1 M NaOH solution at different scan rates. The Ti foil modified with Ni/Al-LDH nanosheet film was evaluated as the working electrode of a nonenzymatic glucose sensor in 0.1 M NaOH solution at desired potential. Amperometric curves were obtained after adding a glucose solution of certain concentration into the electrolyte. The current in each experiment was recorded after it reached a steady state. 3 Results and discussion 3.1 Preparation and characterization of the Ni/Al-LDH nanosheet film grown directly on Ti substrate Our group successfully developed a single coprecipitation method to fabricate Ni/Al-LDH nanosheet film on Ti foil which was relatively inert in the measurement of electrochemical analysis. The fabrication process was shown in Fig. 1 . In the process of preparation, urea played an important role. The hydrolysis of urea provided a source of anions for the formation of Ni/Al-LDH and kept the pH of the reaction medium at around 9, especially suitable for the growth of LDH crystallites [21,22] . Furthermore, the slow release of NH 4 + by the hydrolysis of urea at 95 °C was very helpful to the nucleation and growth of LDH seeds on the Ti foil. When the urea was replaced by sodium hydroxide in the experiment, the uniform Ni/Al-LDH film constructed with interconnected nanosheets could not be observed on the Ti foil. The X-ray diffraction (XRD) pattern of the Ni/Al-LDH nanosheet film on Ti foil is shown in Fig. 2 a . It shows three characteristic diffraction peaks at 11.644°, 23.348° and 35.482°, corresponding to the (0 0 3), (0 0 6) and (0 0 9) crystalline planes of Ni/Al-LDH material (Joint Committee on Powder Diffraction Standards file No. 48-0594), respectively. Other strong diffraction peaks could be attributed to the crystalline planes of thick polycrystalline Ti substrate (JCPDS file No. 01-1197). A Fourier transform IR (FT-IR) spectrum of the product is shown in Fig. 2 b. Broad absorption peaks in the region 3477 cm −1 could be assigned to O–H stretching mode of the LDH layer and interlayer water molecules. The corresponding H–OH vibration appears at about 1631 cm −1 . Nitrate anion gives a very strong absorption peak at 1383 cm −1 [23] . The characteristic peak of carbonate anions centered at 1356 cm −1 is not observed, suggesting that the amount of co-intercalated carbonate anions is minimal. A macroscopic image of the Ni/Al-LDH film on Ti substrate is given in Fig. 2 c. From the optical image, we can see the prepared Ni/Al-LDH film was uniform on Ti foils on a large-scale. The typical morphology of the as-prepared Ni/Al-LDH nanosheet film, as observed by scanning electron microscopy (SEM), is illustrated in Fig. 2(d and e) at different magnifications. As can be seen, the film consists of many interconnected nanosheets with thicknesses of 10–20 nm and lateral sizes of 300–600 nm. The small size of these nanosheets ensures the electrochemical activity of the Ni/Al layered double hydroxide material. In addition, these interconnected nanosheets are convenient for the electron transport and penetration of electrolyte. The mechanism for the direct growth of Ni/Al-LDH nanosheet film on Ti foil could be ascribed to the uniform roughness of etched Ti foil surface. Roughness of substrate surface is especially valuable to the reduction of binding energy between seeds and substrate. Therefore, it is more convenient for the nucleation and adhesion of seeds on rough surface than on smooth substrate surface. To confirm this point, a comparative study was made on other substrates such as glass slide and graphite substrate. When Ti foil was replaced by glass slide substrate in the experiment, the Ni/Al-LDH film on glass slide can be easily washed away during the rinsing process. Finally, nothing can be obtained on glass slide. This experiment result showed that smooth substrate surface is not suitable for the direct growth of Ni/Al-LDH nanosheet film. Therefore, without further improvement of preparation method, this reaction cannot be implemented onto other smooth electrodes at present. The experiment result on graphite substrate is given in Fig. 2 f. As can be seen from the SEM image at similar magnification to Fig. 2 d, no uniform Ni/Al-LDH nanosheet film as on Ti foil could be observed on graphite substrate at the same reaction conditions. Unlike glass slide substrate, graphite substrate has a certain degree of roughness. But the roughness of polished graphite surface is not as uniform as etched Ti foil. Hence, only a disorderly Ni/Al-LDH film consists of nanoparticles could be obtained on graphite substrate. This reaction cannot be well implemented onto graphite electrode at present. But this work may be advanced in the future. 3.2 Electrocatalytic oxidation of glucose at Ti foil electrode modified with Ni/Al-LDH nanosheet film Fig. 3 a shows the cyclic voltammograms curves of the prepared electrode in 0.1 M NaOH solution by applying cyclic potentials sweep of 0.05 V/s, 0.09 V/s and 0.13 V/s in the range of 0–0.7 V. As indicated, the electrode exhibits a pair of redox peaks with the anodic and cathodic peak potential positioned at 0.52 V and 0.37 V in the blank NaOH solution, which are assigned to the Ni(II)/Ni(III) redox couple forming in the alkaline medium [24] . In addition, the peak currents increase according to the increase of scan rate. Fig. 3 b shows the cyclic voltammograms curves obtained at the Ti foil electrode modified with Ni/Al-LDH nanosheet film in 0.1 M NaOH solution in the absence and presence of 0.5 mM glucose. It can be observed that after injecting glucose into the solution, the anodic peak current obviously increases which due to the well-known catalytic effect of the Ni 2+ /Ni 3+ redox couple for oxidation of glucose to glucolactone. The electro-oxidation mechanism can be represented by the following reaction [25] : (1) LDH − Ni(II) + OH sol − → LDH(OH − ) − Ni(III) + e − (2) LDH(OH − ) − Ni(III) + Glucose → LDH − Ni(II) + Glucolactone The anodic peak response currents obtained at different potential scan rates in the presence of 0.5 mM glucose in 0.1 M NaOH electrolyte are given in Fig. 4 a . As can be seen, the response currents increase linearly according to the increase of potential scan rate. In order to understand whether the Ti substrate is involved in the electrocatalytic process, control cyclic voltammetry experiment is performed at the blank Ti foil electrode in 0.1 M NaOH solution in the absence and presence of 0.5 mM glucose. The curves are given in Fig. 4 b. It exhibits no pair of redox peaks and there is no difference between two curves which means no current response to glucose can be obtained at the blank Ti foil electrode. The result confirms it is the Ni/Al-LDH nanosheet film plays a significant role in the electrocatalytic oxidation of glucose. 3.3 Amperometric determination of glucose at Ti foil electrode modified with Ni/Al-LDH nanosheet film After the back ground current become stable, a solution of glucose is regularly injected into the electrolytic cell under optimized detection potential at 0.70 V. Each injection change the glucose concentration of electrolyte at 0.5 mM. Fig. 5 a shows the amperometric responses of the electrode to the addition of glucose solution. As indicated, current increases rapidly after each injection of glucose solution to the stirred supporting electrolyte and fast response time within 4 s could be observed. The limit of detection is 5 μM at a signal to noise ratio of 3 ( Fig. 5 a, inset). The corresponding calibration curve is shown in Fig. 5 b. As can be seen, the electrode exhibits an appropriate linear range from 5 μM to 10.0 mM with a sensitivity of 24.45 μA mM −1 cm −2 ( R = 0.99972). When considering the normal physiological level of blood sugar (3–8 mM), the analytical applicability of this sensor is promising. Comparisons to other glucose sensing methods and materials are made and given in Table 1 . Comparisons are focused on nonenzymatic and enzymatic electrochemical glucose biosensors based on kinds of Ni-based material, especially Ni/Al layered double hydroxide. As it can be seen from Table 1 , the proposed glucose sensor shows good sensing performance in terms of detection limit, sensitivity and linear range. Compared with similar hydrotalcite materials, the advantage of this electrode material is obvious. For example, compared with glassy carbon electrode modified with monodisperse Ni/Al-LDH nanoﬂakes [26] , we can see this electrode material exhibit lower detection limit, higher sensitivity and similar linear range. It can be attributed to the direct growth of Ni/Al-LDH nanosheet on Ti foil. First, direct growth of Ni/Al-LDH nanosheet film on Ti foil considerably improves its stability, adhesion and conductivity to the substrate. Second, compared to monodisperse nanoﬂakes, the interconnected structure of nanosheet is more convenient for the electrons transport and its high surface area-to-volume ratio is especially valuable to the increase of electrode electrolyte contact area. These two advantages are helpful to the increase of sensitivity of biosensor and it is also what the Ni/Al-LDH nanosheets offer in terms of glucose sensing. This result also suggests that our method is a positive attempt to construct a glucose biosensor with good analytical performance through a simple way and it may be extended to other glucose biosensors which based on nickel oxide or nickel hydroxide material. The direct growth of sensing material on Ti substrate is not only easy to perform, but also helpful to improve analytical electrochemistry performance of glucose biosensor. The electrode used in this measurement was kept in room temperature and subjected to another measurement after one day. The cyclic voltammograms curve of the used electrode in 0.1 M NaOH solution at scan rate of 0.05 V/s is given in Fig. 6 a . As indicated, No obvious change in the peak potential and peak current was observed. Further repeated tests about the sensitivity of the used electrode were carried out everyday in a week. The result is given in Fig. 6 b. As indicated, the used electrode maintains at least 95.5% of the initial sensitivity in the continuous tests in one week. It shows that the electrode is stable enough to be used for the reduplicative measurement of glucose. 3.4 Real sample analysis Determination of glucose in human serum samples was performed by the developed glucose biosensor based on as-prepared titanium-supported Ni/Al-LDH nanosheet film electrode. The result is given in Table 2 now. It can be seen that the prepared electrode is still effective when the sample is replaced from glucose solution to human serum and accuracy of test results is reliable in a certain range. It implies that the sensing ability of this electrode is not limited to glucose solution. It also can be used to test on real human serum samples. 4 Conclusion The Ni/Al layered double hydroxide nanosheet film grown directly on Ti substrate was successfully prepared by a single coprecipitation method and a nonenzymatic glucose biosensor based on this material was developed. There are several advantages of this glucose biosensor. It is stable enough in the electrochemical measurements which could be ascribed to the good adhesion of Ni/Al-LDH nanosheet to Ti substrate. The fabrication of this electrode can be easily performed in a single step at reasonable cost. After a one-step coprecipitation reaction, the rinsed Ti foils modified with Ni/Al-LDH nanosheet film can be directly used as the working electrode without other treatment. No extra binders such as nafion need to be used during the whole process of fabrication. Moreover, the direct growth of Ni/Al-LDH nanosheet film on Ti foil considerably improves its sensing ability to glucose. In application to electrochemistry, the prepared electrode exhibits high sensitivity, fast response, good stability and an appropriate linear range for the determination of glucose. Combining benefits of good flexibility and high mechanical strength of Ti foils, electrodes of various shapes at different sizes can be easily fabricated and put into practicable applications in the future. YmLf0eSf.title: The Synthesis of 20(S)-Protopanaxadiol Amino Acid Derivatives
YmLf0eSf.abstract: OBJECTIVE To improve the water solubility of 20(S)-protopanaxadiol(PPD) by synthesized with a few kinds of amino acids.METHODS In the synthetic reaction,dicyclohexyl carbodiimide was used as the accelerant and pyridine was the solvent.RESULTS Fourteen derivatives had been synthesized and their chemical structures were identified by 1H-NMR and 13C-NMR.Then the rule of this reaction was summarized.CONCLUSION The method is simple,effective,and reproducible,which is benefit to improve the bioavailability of the drug,and the derivatives have better water solubility than PPD.

H4bNz8we.title: Pharmacokinetic and Metabolism Studies of Curculigoside C by UPLC-MS/MS and UPLC-QTOF-MS.
H4bNz8we.abstract: Pharmacokinetic and metabolism studies were carried out on curculigoside C (CC), a natural product with good antioxidant and neuroprotective effects, with the purpose of investigating the effects of the hydroxyl group at C-3' in curculigoside. A rapid and sensitive method with UPLC-MS was developed and fully validated for the first time in the pharmacokinetic analysis for quantification of CC in rat plasma. The assay was linear (R² > 0.9984) over the concentration range of 1⁻2500 ng/mL, with the lower limit of quantification (LLOQ) being 1 ng/mL. The intra-day and inter-day precision (expressed as relative standard deviation, RSD) ranged from 4.10% to 5.51% and 5.24% to 6.81%, respectively. The accuracy (relative error, RE) ranged from -3.28% to 0.56% and -5.83% to -1.44%, respectively. The recoveries ranged from 92.14% to 95.22%. This method was then applied to a pharmacokinetic study of rats after intragastric administration of 15, 30 and 60 mg/kg CC. The results revealed that CC exhibited rapid oral absorption ( = 0.106 h, 0.111 h, and 0.111 h, respectively), high elimination ( = 2.022 h, 2.061 h, and 2.048 h, respectively) and low absolute bioavailability (2.01, 2.13, and 2.39%, respectively). Furthermore, an investigation on the metabolism of CC was performed by UPLC-QTOF-MS. Twelve metabolites of CC from plasma, bile, urine and faeces of rats were confirmed. The main metabolic pathways of CC, which involve dehydration, glucosylation, desaturation, formylation, cysteine conjugation, demethylation and sulfonation, were profiled. In conclusion, this research has developed a sensitive quantitative method and demonstrated the metabolism of CC in vivo.

DpR8hiCp.title: A strategy to optimize the charge amount of the mixed refrigerant for the Joule–Thomson cooler
DpR8hiCp.abstract: Abstract   The performance of the mixed refrigerant (MR) Joule–Thomson cooler is mainly dependent on the MR circulation composition for a given hardware. However, it is difficult to charge the MR to the desired circulation composition, due to the composition shift. In the present study, a novel strategy was proposed to solve this problem. In this strategy, the MR Joule–Thomson cooler is first charged with the initial charge amount, which is obtained by estimating the MR inventory in the cooler using the homogeneous model. Afterwards, the cooler is started and the MR circulation composition is adjusted to the corresponding optimal composition by adding the MR charge amount stepwise. Additionally, this strategy was verified by an experiment with a ternary mixture of methane, ethane and i-butane. The experimental results indicated that the MR circulation composition was able to be adjusted to the corresponding optimal circulation composition approximately within the relative deviation of ±5%.

pazrMUgZ.title: Effects of Urinary Protease Inhibitor on Activated Leukocytes and Platelets during Extracorporeal Circulation
pazrMUgZ.abstract: OBJECTIVE To investigate the influence of high-dose ulinastatin on cytokines and platelet activation during and after extracorporeal circulation(ECC).METHODS 30 patients with coronary artery disease(CAD) undergoing coronary artery bypass graft(CABG) were randomly divided into two groups: U group(n=15) received a total dose of 1000000 U ulinastatin and C group(n=15) received placebo.Blood samples were withdrawn from the central vein to measure polymorphonuclear neutrophil elastase(PMNE),before induction,30 min following clamping(T2),reperfusion 3 h(T3),reperfusion 6 h(T4) and reperfusion 12 h(T5).Whole blood samples were taken for CD62p immediately before induction(as baseline),at the end of ECC(before protamine administration),1 h after heparin neutralization by protamine and 24 h after the operation. In addition,alveolo-arterial oxygen difference(A-aDO2) in pulmonary gas exchange function was calculated by obtaining arterial blood gas samples before and after ECC.RESULTS There were no differences in preoperative parameters between two groups.After ECC,the levels of PMNE increased in both groups over baseline values(P<0.01).The levels of PMNE,in U group were significantly lower than those in C group(P<0.05).No significant differences in CD62p expression between the 2 groups during ECC were found.AaDO2 in U group significantly decreased compared with C group(P<0.05) and the duration of mechanical ventilation was shorter than C group(P<0.05).CONCLUSION Results suggest that ulinastatin may inhibit PMNE release,reduce reperfusion lung injury and preserve pulmonary function but it fails to inhibit platelet activation and to prevent blood loss during ECC.

TT1zflog.title: The effect of technological parameter on spiral groove of valve roughcast during single cross wedge rolling
TT1zflog.abstract: Spiral dents with tilt angle often happen on the rolling surface of the rolled piece. It's more easily to be formed during cross wedge rolling valve roughcast of 5Cr21Mn9Ni4N. The trace points on rolled pieces were researched by FEM software DEFORM-3D 6. 0 cross wedge rolling under different technological parameter. The experiments using different technological parameters were done on H500 rolling mill. The helical angle of rolled pieces were measured, compared and analyzed. The results of FEM analysis and experiment show that the effecting factors on the spiral groove are the forming angle, the wedge spike round chamfer and the stretching angle in turn. With the increase of forming angle, the spiral groove would strengthen first and then weaken, but it would weaken with the increase of wedge spike round chamfer and stretching angle. The results show that adopting forming angle 28°, stretching angle 8°40'and wedge spike round chamfer 10mm during valve roughcast single cross wedge rolling, it would be not easy for forming spiral groove at the surface.

q2PWdVcm.title: Rooting Study of Cuttings of Piper sarmentosum and Other Wild Piper Plants in Hainan
q2PWdVcm.abstract: Piper sarmentosum Roxb is a wild Piper plant with great value of development and utilization in Hainan.Different concentrations(100,400 and 800mg/L) of 4 different growth regulators(Genwang,IAA,IBA and NAA) were used to study the rooting technology of cuttings of P.sarmentosum with the base of the cuttings soaked for different time(0.5h,2h and 4h).The results showed that,with respect to rooting rate,average number of roots,and length of the longest root,all treatments obtained better results than those of the control.The best was the treatment with 100 mg/L IBA for 5h,with the rooting rate of 80.00%,the average number of roots 5.67 and the length of the longest root 10.6cm.The other 9 species of Piper in Hainan rooted well using the same method.
